one_reviews_text:
I played this to the 2nd time redo on my older computer but I just got a new computer RTX 3080 with 12700KF and Windows 11.  It just crashes on load now.

Update: 
I found the solution on Reddit.  It has something to do with OpenSSL and newer generation CPUs.
Follow these steps:

Go to System --> Advanced System Settings --> Environment Variables (You might get to this differently in different versions of Windows)

In THE SECOND window ("System Variables") click NEW

Enter name "OPENSSL_ia32cap"

Enter value "0x200000200000000"

Then click OK

You must REBOOT SYSTEM

This solved the crashing problem I was having with several Oculus VR apps and several Steam VR apps.
review_feedback: Thanks for posting a solution to an issue, hopefully that helps other Users!

one_reviews_text:
Some games are good and you enjoy the experiance till the end. Some are bad or less good, so you can decide from the beginning whether you don't want to play it, or go on playing knowing ahead what you are dealing with.
But the worst kind, are the very rare type of games which are actually good, and you want to keep playing them, untill the dificuly level pumps up in such an exegurated and frastraing way, that you give up and stop playing. That leaves a bitter taste and unfortunatly that is the case with this one.
The thing is, the frastration is not because the difficulty of dealing with the enemies, that I managed, but after I did finally got to the end of the level, I lost because I only had 65 out of the 70 pieces of items I needed to collect during the level. I tried this level for I don't know how many times. Every time I either died, or survived but did not have enough peices to pass the level. 
Now this is BS. The gamesplay is fun, hectic and chalanging, but somehow it's like Gandlaph standing there saying "you shall not pass".
Thanks a lot for half of an enjoyable campaign, which took long enough to pass the refund period.
review_feedback:
Dear Yigalzr, Sorry too hear your's having difficulty with Timeline 2, it can be difficult to complete the secondary objective.
The only advice I can give is to focus on shooting off the zombie limbs and you should be able to keep shooting them after they have been killed. I also recommend using the shotgun as it's good for breaking off body parts.

If you have any further issues please let us know on the Official Discord: https://discord.gg/hrU9jHsEMa

review_title: One of the most fun VR games
one_reviews_text:
I love this game. Putting zombies down in different ways is just a blast, it's the one game I play nearly every day. I won't drop a star for these but there's a couple of things - I get the shotgun and so have that and the pistol, but then I HAVE to select the axe which means having to drop one of my ranged weapons. Would be good if I could keep my ranged weapons. The other thing is that the levels seem a bit long when there's no saves in them. If I'm called away or have to deal with an acrobatic cat, I'd like to be able to keep my progress but I can't.

No biggie though. It's a fantastic game and I'd recommend it to anyone who loves a good blasting session without having to think too much.
review_feedback:
Thank you for the positive review!
Please join us on the Discord: https://discord.gg/hrU9jHsEMa

one_reviews_text:
I buy with a friend for co-op. Funny game, not easy, need too talk for team play.
Mic and sound work really good.
review_feedback: Thank you for the positive review!

one_reviews_text:
The game just updated to 1.4.0 and happily removed all the progress. Hours of gameplay lost and a choice: start from scratch or remove the game. I chose the latter.
Edit: after further investigation I found that the game changed the settings location from "c:\Users\user\AppData\LocalLow\Pixel Toys\Drop Dead Dual Strike" to "c:\Users\user\AppData\LocalLow\Pixel Toys\Drop Dead Dual Strike_P2". After manually copying the files from the old dir to the new one the progress was back.
review_feedback:
Dear Tomba, Sorry to hear your progress was removed with the latest update.
We didnt encounter any of this during our testing and havent heard about it from other members of the community.
Did you uninstall / Re-install the game? We dont have cloud saves in Drop Dead so this can clear your progress.
Please feel free to respond on our Discord and we'll be happy to help you: https://discord.gg/bdVq3pGAay

review_title: Lost all my levels after latest update!
one_reviews_text:
Hi Developers, why have i lost all my levels after latest update?
Now game starts from beginning :(

Hello Devs, i didn't hear back from you re previous update and now with latest 1.4.0 update i have lost all my progress again. Please help!
review_feedback:
Dear Aviboy,
We had an issue with the last build where it was saving the save data in the wrong location. 

If you put your save file into the non P2 folder you should be fine :)
If it doesn't please contact us through the Discord: https://discord.gg/bdVq3pGAay

one_reviews_text:
I didn't have any expectations when I bought this because I thought it will be just another regular wave shooter game.
I was surprised to experience a fun game with some cool horde challenges which I just do once in a while because it's pretty fun.
I also love the voice acting which adds some story to the game.
I also love the fact that you have a small set of weapons and this is exactly what you need without any modifications or upgrades to chase after.
Overall, a very fun wave shooter for solo or co-op.
You'll should make a add on with survivor horde multiplayer mode
review_feedback: Thank you for the positive review!!!

one_reviews_text: This games just good fun.  It's kinda old school, but that doesn't make it any less awesome.  A great range of weapons make blasting zombies very entertaining.  A simple story pushing everything along.  The best part is the survival co-op multiplayer, a complete blast with a friend.

review_title: One of my favorite vr games
one_reviews_text: I had so much fun playing this game on my friend's oculus quest that i knew if i got an oculus i would get this game. Literally worth every penny
review_feedback: Glad you enjoy the game so much!!

one_reviews_text: This is an awesome arcade zombie shooter.  In game graphics are pretty good, not the absolute best but this game is sooo much fun.  The arcade mode is just awesome and a great game to get friends into VR.

review_title: I want to download another computer but.
one_reviews_text:
it is a amazing game. I want to paly game with my  friends . so I tried to download it  it is hard to serch drop dead to store what can i  do this?

혹시 몰라서 한국말로 남겨요 다른 컴퓨터에 깔고 싶은데 드랍데드가 안나와요 어떻게 해야 해요???

First played this on my Oculus Go, even BETTER on my Rift S.
Great work. Good story line and even has co-op now!

Drop Dead is a VR arcade shooter that makes me feel nostalgic just playing it. I enjoy it and prefer it over Robo Recall. I do however have some things to say about it.
First of all, nothing is spread out. You witness all of the new things at one time. If you put newer zombies in the 2nd and 3rd timeline than that would make a big difference.
Second, The co-op doesn't have much to it. If you made a co-op campaign for 2 to 4 players, that would also be nice.
Lastly, the game focuses mostly on just two big levels. You could at least give the farm world a boss of some sort.

Conclusion, it's a great game, it just needs some more work put into it.

review_title: This version and the quest version buggy
one_reviews_text: Great game, I've spent hours and hours on this game. Very fun. However I've played the quest version and this desktop version, and when I reach the final level/showdown, the huge robot/zombie thing just starts jumping and loops about when I've got it beaten. So I've never been able to finish the game in either version. I was hopeful when I went thru the whole game again via the computer, I could actually finish it, but nope. Same bug in both versions for me.

I own the Rift and the Quest and would like to play in co-op mode with a family member. It does not work ! Ok, quest reset and installed with a new (different) account and bought the game again in the store. Does not work either ! Such a crap. Crossplay with Rift and Quest doesn't seem to be possible. You can configure multiplayer in the game, it doesn't work. The support forum has been full of such issues for months. No reaction from the manufacturer = 1 Star.

Played 2-player co-op - me on Rift, partner on Quest, tremendous fun.  Just wish there was co-op of the main campaign, or more co-op modes.  Superb as it is at the moment however, and excellent value.  5th star if they can add more co-op modes!
Doesn't say, but its an on-rail shooter, but it is fun for the price. Still can't stand on-rail shooters though (not my thing).

good graphict and fun shooter, one of those games you just put on and enjoy not like those cheap shooters that I keep wasting my money on, great graphics, fun story and good aiming with the guns giving it replay value.
Cool arcade Zombie shooter

beautiful game!! my sista and i, are killin it😂
only bad thing i’ll say, same useless pistol..
i wish you could choose the primary weapon of your choice.. either than that, works like a charm..( heaaadshot heaaadshot heeaadshot🤣) thanks to the team who made this game..

House of the dead was one of my all time favourite gun games.
This is that but in VR.
Very enjoyable, good graphics and easy to pick up/put down.

This is like sega House of Dead in VR. Its looks and sounds nice. You feel the good quality. The Gameplay is great. overall its a close to pefekt Rail shooter. I dont finished the Game, but i read about issuse with the last Boss.. 

not sure 5 stars is to high maybe, but this is one of the best in his Genre.
dont buy this game, it is broken, cant even start a co-op game after inviting a friend into the lobby
Nice job guys!

review_title: Great game, but missing one thing...
one_reviews_text:
I love this game, it's a fantastic rail shooter. However, I think it is missing one thing when it comes to Co-Op mode...

I own both the Quest and Rift S. As this game is a cross-buy game, I'd love to play it with my wife in co-op mode. But because it uses your Oculus account to find matches (unlike other games which have you setup an account), I'm unable to play Co-Op as you obviously can't find yourself in matchmaking.

Of course you could refresh the quest, set up a new account and buy all games again, but that is a pain and also makes 'cross buy' games pointless.

If the devs could implement a workaround for this it would truly be a 5* game for me.

great game has smooth graphics. good quality shooter game. tons of targets . just what my VR needed lol. quite possibley one of best games iv gotten lately. great bang for the buck reasonably priced so more people will be able to enjoy. thanks to all people designing this game great job. speaking of jobs i luv to draw and design if u guys are hiring let me know lol luv to be part of yals projects ( ;   thanks for making a great un garbage game u guys knew what u were doing and created a good quality game props goes out to ya. im not easily impressed ( ;

I really like the coop play on this, its the only reason why I bought it. Unfortunately the coop only has 4 levels and 2 of them aren't fun for me. Additionally you are unable to move around and interact with your friend, and its limited to just 2 players. It would be a lot more fun if you could do 3 or 4 players, and if there were more levels. Perhaps levels where you don't have to constantly circle around and look for cheap shot zombies all the time. That just makes me paranoid.

I've bought most of the zombie and shooter games on the Oculus, Arizona Sunshine, Brookhaven Experiment, all the gun range games, the gunfighting games (Drop dead, etc) and in my view this is the best shooter so far. Great enemies, great action, great cheesy storyline, plenty of missions, even the characters are amusing. Most importantly, the developers have avoided making ridiculous game ruining mistakes. For example, a single button to instantly align VR. Every single game should have the ability to instantly realign the VR view without using a menu. Yet game after game after game is ruined by making it impossibly awkward to realign yourself (The Golf Club VR hang your head in shame for making it literally impossible to get yourself next to the ball to play a shot). But there's more. Seated mode so you don't have to spend 20 minutes trying to set the right height? It's there on the menu at the right. Normal speed bullets rather than tennis-ball sized bullets moving at half-speed (like Drop Dead)? Sorted. I love these guys for the game they've created, and I love them even more for not ruining it.
Thanks a ton for supporting cross-buy between the rift and quest! Would really like to be able to play this game on both my devices at once using self play that other games have implemented though

Needs 4 person horde mode. 
New multiplayer maps.
New wepons. 
Customisable avatars.
Do all this and ill pay $60 for the game!

If you have a friend who has a quest while you have the oculus id highly recommend this game its crossplay and extremely fun to play with your friend especially due to the seated mode so you don't have to tire yourself out due to how long your playing.

If you're having issues joining eachother both of you restarting the game fixes it everytime.

Well I've spent all day trying to download this. On the 3rd 3 hr download at this time. It gets to 97% complete each time then disappears. In the notifications it says my firewall has prevented the download but through the support dept telling me to turn off the antivirus, which I did two downloads ago, I've ran out of options and patience.
But it has some serious control problem with the Rift S. Guns get way off center and you almost have to do the chicken dance to get them to realign.

review_title: Good but I am having glitches
one_reviews_text: I purchased Killing Floor but no-one online. So I tried this. It is a better game but when playing online I get glitches where half my view will go black and then an error message comes up "waiting for players". I have kept the game in the hope that this issue will be resolved. Single player is fine and I play other online games with no online gaming issues .

review_title: Great game... esp playing w/a friend!!!
one_reviews_text: Neither me nor my girlfriend are big gamers (especially my gf!) but we BOTH LOVE this game. We play it almost every night. She has never really been into VR games or experiences -- pretty much just Beat Saber -- but THIS game she wants to play all the time. Great graphics, smooth gameplay, and just super-fun to grab guns and axes and blast and chop up all those zombies, especially with someone else in multiplayer coop mode. We both really like throwing and embedding the axe in their faces! And using a big gun to save your comrade at the last second from getting overrun is very rewarding. I highly recommend this game.

To the guys making updates, since the last update I can't see the Z's in timeline 2 in sauce of woe, they stay stuck on something in the tunnels and I can't shoot them and I run out of time will it be fixed soon?
EDIT: I'm updating to 5 stars cause this game is so much fun. Thanks for resolving the problem
Guys something else came up, I can't invite peoples. it says fatal error when I try to, and sends me to my friend's list in Oculus where i can't invite either. It would be fun if I could see my online friends and seend invite like in  dead and buried. I tried to reload the game but it didn't work. Thanks ;)
This is a great game with a fun campaign and a basic, but fun wave shooter co-op mode. I bought it because I have a Rift S and Quest and I’m excited to be able to play this on both devices.

so usually i detest onrail shooters... like they are awful. is it that hard to make a movement system, and create a much better and dynamic game, i mean you move place to place anyways... just on flippin rails. BUTT, i digress, this game is actually fun. a pleasant surprise. yah sure i felt annoyed at the overall design where you sit in one spot shoot everything and move to next spot to shoot everything, but most of what this game does is done right. now im a manual reload guy so any vr without it i ussually detest. but that said the action is frantic and fun and melee weapons are super smooth to use and throw. the axe lodging into thier skulls makes me weak in the knees for more facebashing. a multiplayer mode which has actual players helps, im guessing the quest release and the games new update are to thank for that. what they need to do is do one last update with manual reload option and a teleport and smooth locomotion option and it will be super duper. till then i have to knock some stars off. ill give 4 only becuase it manages to somehow make a rail shooter fun, which i thought was nearly impossible at this point.
Zombie spawns in the wall and can’t be killed.   Therefore, you can’t go forward. You just stand there.  Fun game until it broke.

Good game. The weapon malfunction / jam feature is highly annoying though. They should remove this. U also have to watch the beginning video clip when u re-start each level (also annoying).  It’s a fun game tho , worth the money for a quick arcade rail shooter. Please remove the weapon malfunction tho !
starts kinda slow but really gets good lot of fun just played again after update good work guys

So I love this game.
 But after the update Im having problems grabbing equipment.
Its like the hitbox that activates the grab mechanism has decreased to become very tiny, making it impossible to get a hold of weapons fast enough.

Did a new sensor setup just to eliminate that as being the issue.
 Hope you fix it :)

Edit: Made a small video to show what I mean. Find it on youtube by searching my nick. ( KlodsBrik ).

review_title: Great but not without it's flaws
one_reviews_text:
Great action, a small but decent selection of weapons, decent graphics, and basically what you'd expect from a zombie rail-shooter. My biggest complaint is some questionable level design (such as civilians who stand still rather than run from zombies or run in front of your bullets *cough* rail shooter *cough*, having to listen to an entire lengthy dialogue over and over when restarting a level), as well as some issues with grabbing items from/placing items on my belt (grenades not sticking, thus priming and dropping). 

It has a great number of levels and I see decent replay value. Overall I do not regret my purchase but some of the times I've been frusturated, I've been really frusturated.

I love this game but I have the same problem of the user kobs57. In timeline 2 in Sauce of Woe the zombie is stuck behind the wall in the tunnel in front of me. I destroy that zombie with a grenade but when another zombie tried to exit the same tunnel is stuck too behind the wall. I DON'T HAVE MORE GRENADES!!!!! Pease fix the game so I can pass to the next level.

EDIT: Thank so much to fix this issue so fast! I love this game!!!! Maybe you guys in the future make a Drop Dead 2!!!

I was looking for a house of the dead game. Instead found the best they have to offer so far. And that's DROP DEAD. Awesome game! I like the cut scene mode. Feels like a classic arcade rail shooter game, but turns insane once you dive in with VR. Worth the buy. Tested on gtx 1080 OCed. Been having a blast with this one.

Purchased the game in 2018 to be used with WMR and worked flawlessly. Recently installed - twice and can no longer get past picking up the first weapon while in the "bad place with the bad guy and the bad ex-co-workers."
how many games do we need from this kind? Its a nice game dont get me wrong but im rly tired from this: Can you pls stop copy each other and do something creative?

the game is fun but this is another case of a developer not understanding firearm mechanics. the guns are already random you dont need to randomize the randomness. yes i know its a game, but a gun is a known object, with known properties, and the number of jams and issues with a revolver and double barreld shot gun just dont happen that often. If i hear watch you dont shoot the civies when im not shooting them i'll loose my marbles. Once this happen it will keep happening over and over and over untill you leave  that round. it always happens to me on the last civi to be save in the cellar of montauk farm.

review_title: Great graphics and classic wave gameplay
one_reviews_text: this game worth all the money, the graphic could look poor from outside, but once you use your rift, then it really shine,  the gameplay is solid, and even the full version of the game with cut scene who aren't intended for those who suffer from motion sickness doesn't affect me all, and i'm suffering from that sickness very badly, i think that could be a mid step for those who are trying to fight motion sickness,  so if you are suffering motion sickness, try the game with the motion options, it only take some cutscene for 2-5 seconds , time after time you ill get slowly comfortable with that!

review_title: Superb Classic HotD Style Rail Shooter
one_reviews_text: Superb Classic HotD Style Rail Shooter really came through - got this game for <7$ CAD it would easily be worth 25$ - great animations, sound, ambiance, the whole thing is just really fun arcade quality rail shooter - a must have classic for the Oculus collection, so nostalgic but really fresh at the same time.

If like me you wish for House of the Dead VR, then this is close as it gets (for now at least) picked up on sale and glad to say its worth the price, plays well and gets difficult towards the end, sometimes perhaps a little too much, as you have to replay whole segments only to die again.  Recommended.

I bought this game at a price lower than 5euro so keep that in mind as you are reading this review.
Let this be clear : this is NOT an horror game, this is NOT an Arizona Sunshine game, a'right ? This is a railshooter with oldschool vibes,a superficial scoring system and cartoony graphics.
Difficulty ain't linear, at all. The first chronology (completed very fast) is nothing but a walk in the park, excepted 2 levels near the end which are WAY more difficult. Then the other chronology brings up the same maps but with new weapons, enemies and scenario. The game finally becomes interesting when you hit chronology 2, as the difficulty kicks in, and the game starts to look more like a die and retry game than a mini game for 12 year boys. But this is also where the flaws of the game start annoying you. VERY MUCH.
2 main issues in game : when I restarted more than twice a mission, I had to relaunch the game because there was a bug where I could not take a gun in hand anymore. And also... YOU CANT SKIP CUTSCENES. OH, MY, GOD. There is literraly this moment when you know the dialogues by heart. You can't do this. You can't make a game without a saving system if you don't allow people to skip cinematics. 
I don't regret buying it on sale, but I would have if I bought it full price.

Drop Dead delivers exactly what the trailer is promising - a straightforward and fun rail shooter that comes with excellent gunplay and good controls.---

The graphics are really nice, nothing too fancy; but they will let you immerse in the scenario quickly. Drop Dead comes with a cartoonish look that is quite fitting for the lighthearted tone of the game.-----

The Touch controls work flawlessly and can be switched between right- and left-handed gun control. One hand controls the gun, gear and health potions are used with the other hand. Even people who are not familiar with VR, Touch controllers or even video games will get the hang of it very quickly. (You should see my dad...)-----

Soon you will feel like a true gunslinger, no matter if you decide to play safe and shower those zombies with a hail of bullets fired from the hip or take your time and aim downsight for a headshot. Which is quite precise, by the way.-----

Overall a really fun shooter, I have payed less than 6 Euro during a promotion and this actually feels like a steal. Even if I had payed the full 15 Euros I would not have been disappointed.-----

Sooo, why only 3 out of 5 stars, you might ask? Well, that is because of the german synchronisation. I really appreciate that there IS a german version, but to be honest; the german synchro is kind of underwhelming in comparison to the english version and I would LOVE to play DD in English. And I can't switch to english, no matter what, even deleting the game; switching the Oculus software to English and re-install the game has no effect.-----

This might look like a small thing, but it is kind of thoughtless and since I really do not like the german synchro (which is kind of lackluster and, even worse, quite often completey incorrect when you know what the NPCs say in the english version.-----

(If I have missed something here, my apologies. In this case, please point me into the right direction and I will change this review ASAP!)

Relatively straightforward rail shooter, with a nice selection of different weapons. The difficulty ramps up nicely, few last levels being quite challenging. Horde mode is nice, but I still haven't found a partner to try out the multiplayer aspect.


The gripes of the game are it's few bugs, sometimes not being able to take a gun, unskippable dialog  and the final boss bugged a few times for me. You might need to restart the game a few times during your playtrough, but nothing major.


All in all, a great singleplayer vr railshooter and easily worth the relatively low price. I paid $5 for this, but would not feel too bad if it was $20.


I was considering giving this 3 stars because of the bugs and lackluster multiplayer matchmaking, but it would get 5 stars if those issues would be fixed. So 4 stars it is.

The accuracy n precision is almost as good as dead n buried .
This title will push your prereferral vision and mulititasking.
has a fair amount of levels then has you redo with twist to story line-creative.
Multi player mode lobby set up is not the greatest ,-but sigleplayer mode is reasonably entertaing and  if you can catch this still for around ten bucks on rift, it is worth it for sure. 
On the flip side Gear mobile version of this titile needs work
House of the Dead, almost.  Much better than I'd thought it would be.
This game is well polished compared to others in the same price range. It has a great arcade vibe like Robo Recall and it is co-op! Which isn't easy to find in this price range.

It was a solid 5* for me until severe performance issues in map 14 and 15, gameplay freezing for up to 5 seconds. Pretty sure this is an uncommon bug, so give this great game a go if you liked HotD. Music and voice acting are pretty good, reload mechanic is fun and the difficulty level is right on spot.
couldent stop playing, enjoyed it very much

Really fun modernized take on classic light gun games like House of the Dead.  There are a few rough edges (like some of the environment textures and the fact the ground is about a foot too high), but it doesn't really detract from the fun.  I like the active reload mechanic for this type of fast-paced game and the fact that you actually have to aim without using laser sights as a crutch the whole time.  The waves seem spaced out well: I was never bored but my arms didn't really get tired either, which is nice.  Campaign seems like it will be longer than I expected; there are actually three sets of around 15 levels each which have repeat environments (tied in with the story) but different enemies and new/upgraded weapons each time so they don't really feel the same.  The endless horde mode seems fun, too.

You cannot beat this game. The final boss glitches out. I have tried 10 times to beat him but every time I get to a certain point the boss just starts to bounce up and down for eternity and there is nothing you can do. This issue has been posted about since March and no update has been made. I will update the review whenever this issue is fixed.

review_title: Let me grab the gun bro
one_reviews_text: This game is really good. Everything feels really nice exept from one thing.I dont mind this type of reloading mechanic its whatever but what I really want is to be able to grab the foregrip of some guns in the game like the rifle. It would make the whole experience a lot more emercing and the shooting twice as fun.This is why I am also not willing to give this fifth start.Yet.
I Love It.... Period
Played quite abit in one run. Love Railshooters, this beter becuase its in VR & they have done it right.
Graphics didn't sell me on this game so never bought, caught it on sale figure wth, definitely fun~  Glad I bought.

review_title: It's okay - not what I expected
one_reviews_text: If I had known it was on rails I probably wouldn't have bought it. I don't like the reload mechanic especially after playing Arizona Sunshine. Otherwise it seems fun having played the first few levels.
This game is high quality. I wish they included locomotion and allowed players to carry two guns at once though.

I've always loved these sort of games, Drop Dead is an old school On-Rails/Lightgun game. I've just played until the halfway point (7/15 levels) and its great fun. Took me around half an hour to get there so there isn't a great deal of content but the replayability that this game has makes up for it. Lightgun games have always been short experiences but these games are all about getting high scores and ending up on the Leaderboard at the end of the day.

As well as the zombies there are also various props to shoot such as crows, bottles and pumpkins for bonus points so it's going to be a challenge to complete this game 100% because halfway through things started to get a bit hectic lol. Definitely worth purchasing!

I usually don't like "On-Rails Shooters."  In fact, they are usually pretty terrible.  Reminds me of mobile gaming or old consoles with laugable gameplay.  However, this game re-invents the on-rails experience.  You're not just playing whack-a-mole or shooting at pop-up targets.  You're actually in a story,  front and center in a cartoonish zombie apocalypse romp and those zombies should be scared of you.  The cut scenes are done fantastically and they are just long enough to keep you entertained while you take a break from zombie killing.  But make no mistake, you're the main star in your action hero story, arcade style, guns ablazing.  And this game rewards precise shooting and quick thinking.  After finishing a level, I would often want to replay the same level to get an even higher score.  Not because I'm some sort of OCD completionist or achievement hunter, but because it's just a lot of fun to be this VR zombie ultra-killer and you notice things you could do even better next time.  Definite must buy, especially for casual gamers *spoiler* at the start, you will be overwhelmed and that's supposed to happen *spoiler*

Its nothing special but it is kind of fun.
The levels are short but have a fun combo-highscore meter so its fun to go for a high score on the leaderboard.
It's also fun to see a game implement the active time reload from Gears of war(every game should).
Graphics are mweh but get the job done.
The game has 15 lvl's that you walk through 3 times,but the story and difficulty change a lot so it isnt a bother.

nothing special,but worth it at a sale price!

The game is fun but it just doesn't work properly. At various points the guns simply stop reloading and you die.  Pulling objects toward you is also unreliable and frequently gets you killed.  After replaying the same level multiple times and dying in the same spot I'd had enough.
good fun arcade style on rails zombie shooter quite simular to house of the dead but wait till its in the sale.

Even at the regular price, this is arguably one of the better values for a VR game.

It's an update of a Gear VR game, so the graphics aren't terribly impressive but at least they are polished and don't require a beefy system.

The levels are short and each basically serves more as a checkpoint. The game also reuses each level 2 more times but with different difficulty and challenges.

The challenge really ramps up near the end and can be frustrating at times because you have to protect people and act quick but at least the game gives you different ways to manage it.

In all, it's a simple rail shooter but a fun and polished one with replayability and multiplayer.

review_title: Cool game with cheap repetition tricks
one_reviews_text: I had fun with the game but the levels are re-used ad naseum and it becomes really frustrating later on. For some reason you will instantly lose if you accidentally shoot a civilian, or if the zombies get their hands on one. The world is infested with these murderous creatures but without the mountain backpappers we're all doomed apparently. Another gameplay element that almost drove me insane was the "collect at least x number of limbs in order to complete level". Doesn't matter if you beat the level with all perfect headshots, nope... Levels start to reappear at least three times with very small if any variation to them. What starts out as a fun and scary experiences later devolves into feeling like a job. Controls are somewhat messy when it comes to picking up objects in the game world. Too often you will die because of it. Anyway it's a pretty fun ride if you take it for what it is. I might sound overly critical but it is sad to see a missed opportunity to create something that falls short of being truly spectacular.

For the price this is a must have shooter !
Graphics are very good, ambiance is arcade style, love it ! Do not hesitate ! Very very fun !
1 star removed cause of bugs ! (dark screen during level, ending score not coming at end of "to the helico" level etc)
This is a fun game. Graphics are deliberately cartoonish which works well and I like the green colour schemes. A good first person shooter.
This is a great on rails shooter, lots of Fun, well worth a buy. Glad I bought it.

I was very impressed by this at first. Altho Zs clip each other, graphics are generally very appealing. Also, the character animation is excellent and the lip syncing of the dialog is nearly perfect. This MUST be a very hard thing to get right, since so few games attempt it, and fewer do it well, most preferring to fall back solely on video or "radio" communications with game characters. On the downside: 1) This is an ON RAILS experience, which not only takes some getting used to, but is not as immersive as free exploration. 2) You can only hold ONE weapon at a time 3) You can hit the big guys in the head 5 times in a row, but only the last hit is counted as a "headshot" 4) You can't keep weapons 5) You can't hit zombies with your guns between reloadings 6) You can't dodge projectiles 7) You can't move to a better vantage point. 8) When you replay a level, you have to watch its intro each time. 9) No dificulty levels. If you can't make it past a sticking point, you can't finish the game. Still fun, but not as good as it could be.
An excellent game, basic arcade style setup but really satisfying and fun to play.  Some vr games try to over acheive, this is pure fun.
Very boring and average, poor characters, very bad graphics, shooting just feel bad.
Way too much fun! :-)

This is one of them games ive looked at for months, ummin an arrin. WISH I BOUGHT IT EARLIER !      This game  ROCKS !!!
Great for sitting comfy too .
Quite entertaining if you like zombie shooters on rails. Reloading can be a little frustrating, but the biggest drawback is no checkpoints mid-level.
Really Entertaining Shooter. Well presented and feels like its the perfect level of difficulty. Nicely done!

review_title: House Of The Dead in VR
one_reviews_text: Graphics are poor, but the (old school) gameplay is good. It's front facing and not scary, but it has a story. Initially had some frustration with reloading, with figuring out the amount of amo left on special weapons, with collecting enough samples... all of which I ended up figuring out because the game mechanics work fine. At 25/45 levels (three walkthroughs of 15 levels) I'm only halfway through, and keep coming back to complete an extra level or two on my way to reaching the end of the story.

GG. I had a lot of fun with it. There's repetition and not a lot of story, but It's worth the money if you like a moderate to high difficulty VR shooter with some solid weapons.  I did have to rerun several of the levels a few times due to the game crashing or locking up. I powered through it because it was so enjoyable.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QnhYhRAZLao - Many moons ago you would find me hanging around the arcades putting many a coin into the zombie shooters with the plastic guns on the cabinet. This game brought back all those happy memories and more. "More you say?" Yes more as now I'm actually inside the amazing worlds of those classic arcade games I used to play. All thanks to the power of VR!

review_title: I don't mind dying but I hate the intros
one_reviews_text:
I don't mind dying but I hate the intros playing from the start, every time!!! Arrrghh!!
Having said that, I obviously keep coming back cos it's fun but please let the user skip the intros!!

Really bad. There is no way to set the difficulty, in timeline 3 it just gets way to hard - at least for me (and I easily managed the other VR shooters I own). If you're not a shooting pro, don't buy it. It is just frustrating not to be able to finish the game.
Update: Pixel Toys answered my questions quickly and helped. I still think the difficulty in the final level  is too high, but due to their support I change to 3 stars.

If you like House of The Dead, you are going to love this. The game is an absolute bargain at this price. Lots of replayability. Great graphics, good gameplay and great fun. On top of the casual VR gaming list. Just strap in and enjoy!

So far I'm about 10 minutes in and having a lot of fun so I thought I'd write a review.  Fun graphics, fun zombies, fun weapons, fun fun fun.  I think it's well worth the $20 so far. Sure it's a zombie shooter on rails but it's good fun.  I'm heading back in.  Hope you enjoy.

Edit:  I'm through timeline 1.. It sucks that Timeline 2 is just the same level with a variation on enemies and weapons.  I was hoping for unique levels.  Oh well.  It's still fun after playing for a couple hours so far!

Have been unable to get this to work since buying. On two different headsets. Nowhere to get help, either. Just crashes after the load screen and all I get is a blank heaset.
Update: Having finally got it working, I actually enjoy it a lot - lots of fun. I haven't progressed that far into it, but have played from the beginning several times (I'm disabled so I get tired and pain pretty quick with this kind of game).  It could work better, as I often have difficulty picking up a new weapon and each time I failed to get through a level, this was the reason.

review_title: Whats not fun about killing Z's
one_reviews_text:
This game is fun and simple without allot of complicated mechanics to master. The multiplayer is great and has very nicely laid out game creation/invite functionality. Using the Oculus avatar is a very nice touch. In my opinion its a must have game if you are a zombie lover. There are three things that need attention in my opinion. 

1: The gun failures happen extremely consistent when the SHTF in survival mode. If a horde gets close the gun fails almost 100% of the time. 

2: Weapon upgrades are not often enough and not enough ammo in survival mode.

 3. The ability to dual wield when your lucky enough to get an upgraded weapon.

A big THANK YOU goes out to all the Dev's for working hard to bring more quality content to the Oculus platform and the Oculus team for bringing such quality hardware to run it on!!!!
Great rails shooter that has plenty of content for a good price. Being a GearVR port, the graphics are a bit on the simple side but the gameplay is top notch.
what more to say? it is worth the asking price.
played really well, but the game will not let me complete it! I just keep getting a bouncing final boss, so frustrating.

I'll keep it short but sweet, this game reminds me so much of sega's classic house of the dead series. At 10 bucks this game is a steal. What are you waiting for, hurry up and buy this game right now before the price jumps back up to 20 bucks

Reminds me of old on-rails shooters. There is a story, not a deep one, but it's there to give you a reason to shoot thousands of zombies. Mad scientist, different timelines etc. The art style is nice and simple. There are some variation with the zombies and guns. Entertaining game, a bit repetive but fun in short bursts.
Loved House of the Dead arcade shooter games. This is how they can work in VR. Just  love it. Also the autowalking between the shootings. works very well for me. No motion sickness at all.

Game has fun and sexy character as guide that really keeps you going...  Only she surprises you in the scene sometimes and you might shoot her by accident ending the game.  Great game play and cool story line.  This is a must have game when you just want to have some fun or a break.  This game will not make you motion sick in any option like they warn..  Not me anyway and I get motion sick real easy..  Love this game...

Graphics are good but need better effects for headshot and zombie kills. I really like the confort mode and the fact action is in front of you. Ideal for fun with freinds at home ! 5 Stars considering the price :)

Im enjoying this game more then I expected to.. Pretty good graphics (for originally being a GearVR title), controls are easy and fun (w/touch), & a so so storyline, but overall I say its worth the price! I have spent more on worse games!  Only complaint is each level is way to short. I have not played multiplayer yet....
I am having heaps of fun with this game. Well worth the cost for a good single player experience. A good port from Gear VR with great touch controls.

Superbly well put together on rails shooter. If you ever digged House Of The Dead down the arcades you'll be right at home. A quality game with high production values, decent price and exciting undead carnage!
I really love this game, it's incredibly good fun, shooting zombies in the face always is.
A good zombie game on rails. Nice graphics and background storyline.
Well worth the money, like being in the arcade playing house of the dead.
Really happy about this purchase. Its a fun little shooter with lots of replayability.
